author: Isobel Lee
title: London’s Crossrail Project Loses Traction as Political Obstacles Mount
text:
London residents who for years have been coping with the construction of the city’s most ambitious new transportation project since World War II began to get their payoff last year with the partial opening of the first line of the £14.8 billion ($23 billion) Crossrail system.
But for many real-estate developers and investors, the payoff will take longer. Plans for 12 projects with more than 3 million square feet of office, retail and residential space are in the works over and near the new Elizabeth line stations and construction...
